intro: Psychotria tomentella, commonly known as the woolly psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria tomentella is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and its role in ecological systems.
